Sentencas: Anode cermets using various transition metals (Ni, Co, and Fe) and Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-sigma (SDC) were prepared and their catalytic activity for ammonia oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) was investigated.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Ni/SDC showed a high activity for hydrogen, but not for ammonia.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Co/SDC showed a poor activity for both hydrogen and ammonia.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Fe/SDC has the highest activity for ammonia oxidation in the temperature range of 973 to 1173 K.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Moreover, it was found that Ni-Fe alloy/SDC anodes showed improved performance for ammonia oxidation.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Ni40-Fe60/SDC anode showed the highest catalytic activity for NH3 oxidation, and therefore is promising for ammonia-fueled SOFCs.
Titulo: Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells
Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells
Ni-Fe/Sm-doped CeO2 anode for ammonia-fueled solid oxide fuel cells
